entry.title: Game: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons - 2nd Edition (P&P, 1989)
entry.content:
Game: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons - 2nd Edition (P&P, 1989)20161001
I played this version of D&D a lot when I was younger and really
liked it a lot. Looking back, I think that it made the wrong
things too complicated.

entry.title: Game: Arkham Horror (Board, 2015)
entry.content:
Game: Arkham Horror (Board, 2015)20161001
My wife and I played this a lot when we first got it, but quickly
found ourselves optimizing the game and winning all the time,
whereas when we first played it seemed to be very challenging.

entry.title: Game: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game (Board, 2012)
entry.content:
Game: Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game (Board, 2012)20161001
My son really likes this game, although he doesn't really know how
to play correctly (he doesn't use the spells or follow the rules
about dungeon size or room placement.) I find it too simple and
easy.

  • Boss Monster: The Dungeon Building Card Game

entry.title: Game: Carcassonne (Board, 2009)
entry.content:
Game: Carcassonne (Board, 2009)20161001
This is a very fun game. My wife doesn't like playing with me
because I beat her too many times, but I think the game has so
much luck and subtle strategy that I'm not a master yet.
  • Video Games
  • Carcassonne
  • Board
  • 2009

entry.title: Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition (Board, 2012)
entry.content:
Game: Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition (Board, 2012)20161001
I have played this a few times with my son and really loved it. He
is not tactical enough as the Overlord and is too sensitive to
losing as a Player for it to be a ton of fun though.
  • Video Games
  • Descent: Journeys in the Dark 2nd Edition

entry.title: Game: Dungeon World (P&P, 2012)
entry.content:
Game: Dungeon World (P&P, 2012)20161001
I played this once with the kids, but they had a hard time
understanding all the moves available, so instead we just adapted
the rules to a variety of situations and circumstances. Harry
Potter was really fun.
  • Video Games
  • Dungeon World
  • P&P
  • 2012

entry.title: Game: Dungeons & Dragons - 4th Edition (P&P, 2008)
entry.content:
Game: Dungeons & Dragons - 4th Edition (P&P, 2008)20161001
I played a long campaign of this with some friends in *REDACTED*. I know
that a lot people don't like it, but I really found it awesome. I
love the board game-y/video game-y nature of it and the huge
amount of tactical options.

I played a tiny bit with my son and just did combat scenarios. He
seemed to get it when I showed him the power cards.

I think it would cool to build a "typical" party and fight every
monster in the original books in a long level-1-to-30 campaign
arc.
  • Video Games
  • Dungeons & Dragons - 4th Edition
  • P&P
  • 2008

entry.title: Game: HeroQuest (Board, 1989)
entry.content:
Game: HeroQuest (Board, 1989)20161001
When I was young, I played this a lot and eventually got a lot of
expansions---Kellar's Keep and The Frozen Horror. I remember that
I played it for the first time with my neighbors and then I bought
my own copy and did it all the time. I recently found a copy on
Ebay and bought it. 

So far, I've gone through the first few levels with my son as
Zargon. I am using all four characters and I can see that the game
wasn't quite really designed for all four and that it was a fault
to not have the monsters scale with the players. Another design
flaw is that there's basically no reason to not always search
every room for treasure in an attempt to get lots of
resources. All this, combined with my son not yet being a
tactician, makes it a bit of an easy game. I'd really like for him
to want to be the player, but for some reason he doesn't want to.
  • Video Games
  • HeroQuest
  • Board
  • 1989

entry.title: Game: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot (Blue & Yellow) (Board, 2002)
entry.content:
Game: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot (Blue & Yellow) (Board, 2002)20161001
This is fun game to play at the complexity level and it is good
fun silliness that you are just increasing your chance of winning
by doing well, not actually winning.

entry.title: Game: Magic the Gathering - Commander 2015 (Board, 2015)
entry.content:
Game: Magic the Gathering - Commander 2015 (Board, 2015)20161001
I've played these a few times with my kids and family. It is
really awesome that there's so much variability and that there is
no reason to ever get new cards. So far, each deck is crazy in its
own ways.
  • Video Games
  • Magic the Gathering - Commander 2015
  • Board
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Minecraft Card Game? (Board, 2015)
entry.content:
Game: Minecraft Card Game? (Board, 2015)20161001
I dislike this game, but my kids like it because of the theme. It
is too simple. They always lose because they never think to build
things with their materials and they just want the expensive
ores like Diamond, rather than what they need to build things.
  • Video Games
  • Minecraft Card Game?
  • Board
  • 2015

entry.title: Game: Mr. Jack (Board, 2008)
entry.content:
Game: Mr. Jack (Board, 2008)20161001
I played this once and it felt very straight-forward and obvious
what to do, except when you were guessing and there was no way to
think your way to an advantage.

entry.title: Game: Pocket Odyssey (Board, 2014)
entry.content:
Game: Pocket Odyssey (Board, 2014)20161001
The idea of this is great, but in practice there are too many
little things to really make it portable. I can't imagine opening
this up in a car and having all the little cards go flying. I've
played it a few times with my kids and they really like making
their characters, but they can never remember to actually use
their special items and attacks.
  • Video Games
  • Pocket Odyssey
  • Board
  • 2014

entry.title: Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (21)
entry.content:
Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (21)20160928
I played for about five days. Mostly I worked on my slime farm,
but I don't really know why I'm doing it. I got to the maximum
level with Penny and I'm still waiting to have kids with her. I
just heard about the 1.1 revision, which could be awesome.

Total time: 51:38
  • Video Games
  • Stardew Valley
  • Steam
  • 2016

entry.title: Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (20)
entry.content:
Game: Stardew Valley (Steam, 2016) (20)20160927
I just played the first two days of summer. I didn't realize that
the scythe can get rid of dead plants, so I took forever doing it
using the pickaxe which also depleted my energy. I missed a very
"Lucky" day as well, which was a bummer. 

Total time: 50:09
  • Video Games
  • Stardew Valley
  • Steam
  • 2016
